Comment: Roman Catholics in America have a long history of left-leaning social positions (aside from abortion).    It would be interesting to hijack their leftist inclinations and use the Catholic Church against the demons that represent MAGA.  We could demand that public schools teach charity for the poor, and good will toward all of God's creatures, even immigrants.   I wonder how fast MAGA would demand separation of church and state. ____________________________________________________  The Church has a long tradition of supporting the poor and marginalized, with involvement in various social justice movements on the left.  It's been involved in the labor movement, advocating for workers' rights and fair wages.  Many prominent figures in the Civil Rights Movement were Catholic and played a big role in advocating for equality and racial justice. It's also been involved in peace movements and anti-war activism, challenging military interventions.

Comment: **From Clarissa-Jan Lim, breaking/trending news writer for MSNBC Digital:**  As Cardinal Robert Prevost, Leo had posted an article from National Catholic Reporter in February that rebutted Vance’s interpretation of a Catholic theological concept, “ordo amoris,” as a hierarchy of Christian love. Days later, he shared on X an article from America Magazine that was critical of Trump’s immigration policies and the rhetoric demonizing migrants.  His last public activity on X was in April, when he reposted an essay from Bishop Evelio Menjivar, an auxiliary bishop of the Roman Catholic Archdiocese of Washington, who condemned the administration’s legally questionable immigration enforcement tactics.  As his social media posts made the rounds, several prominent MAGA influencers spoke out against the new papal leader. Far-right conspiracy theorist Laura Loomer, who has Trump’s ear, wrote a series of posts trashing the pope, including one calling him “anti-Trump, anti-MAGA, pro-open Borders, and a total Marxist like Pope Francis.”  Read more: [https://www.msnbc.com/top-stories/latest/maga-world-pope-leo-xiv-criticizes-trump-immigration-rcna205806](https://www.msnbc.com/top-stories/latest/maga-world-pope-leo-xiv-criticizes-trump-immigration-rcna205806)

Comment: Roman Catholics in America have a long history of left-leaning social positions (aside from abortion).   Social Justice Advocacy: The Church has a long tradition of supporting the poor and marginalized, which has led to its involvement in various social justice movements, including those on the left.    Labor Movement: The Church has historically been involved in the labor movement, advocating for workers' rights and fair wages.    Civil Rights Movement: Many prominent figures in the Civil Rights Movement were Catholic and played a significant role in advocating for equality and racial justice.    Anti-War Movements: The Church has also been involved in peace movements and anti-war activism, challenging military interventions and advocating for diplomacy.    New Deal Coalition: In the 1930s and 1950s, Catholics were a core part of the New Deal Coalition, supporting liberal policies in domestic affairs.    Catholic Democrats: Many Catholics have historically voted for the Democratic Party, particularly in the 20th century.   Liberal Catholicism: A distinct branch of Catholicism, known as Liberal Catholicism, has embraced social and political reforms, advocating for individual freedoms and social justice.
